body:
Hey @jstoppelman ,
I am not sure, but maybe your test set is very small? You use 4/5 of the data for training and 1/5 for validation. This means that there is not much left for testing? If the test set only contains 1 or two datapoints, different results can occur. Can you try to use e.g. num_train=0.8 and num_val=0.1 or something similar?
Stefaan

@Stefaanhess Thank you for the reply! I adjusted num_train=0.8 and num_val=0.1, but the validation MAE output in the log.csv file still plateaus around 0.6 eV/atom during training, and the test MAE gives a similar result at 0.62 eV/atom. This is still pretty far off from what I would expect, and I still can't find anything wrong with the code used to setup the model...
I am not sure what has gone wrong... Could there be an issue with the units in the database? Did you use the automatic download of the MaterialsProject class to generate the database?

Did you try using a different patience/learning rate? In the code examples you use a `lr=0.0001` and `patience=5`, which might both be to low. The low patience in particular could cause the plateau you see. In the paper we used values of `lr=0.001` and `patience=25`.

@Stefaanhess yes, I used the automatic download of the MaterialsProject class so I believe the units are correct and are in terms of eV. @mgastegger thank you for the suggestion, I've changed the `lr` and `patience` to 0.01 and 25 respectively and I'll see how that affects the MAE.

Reporting back after changing the `lr`. The MAE does improve to 0.36 eV/atom in comparison to before. Is it strange that the training set loss improves throughout the training, while the validation loss essentially plateaus? Going through the code, I believe that there are no unit conversions from the initial eV that the dataset is downloaded with using `matproj.py`, is this correct? I was trying to double check the units to make sure that they aren't changing for some reason, but it doesn't look like they do.
![mae_matproj](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30512460/85082884-c9140f80-b195-11ea-91bd-37e81d1110f8.png)

> Reporting back after changing the `lr`. The MAE does improve to 0.36 eV/atom in comparison to before. Is it strange that the training set loss improves throughout the training, while the validation loss essentially plateaus? Going through the code, I believe that there are no unit conversions from the initial eV that the dataset is downloaded with using `matproj.py`, is this correct? I was trying to double check the units to make sure that they aren't changing for some reason, but it doesn't look like they do.
> ![mae_matproj](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30512460/85082884-c9140f80-b195-11ea-91bd-37e81d1110f8.png)

Hi!
What you have there is a clear example of overfitting! were the training loss decreases while the validation loss increases.
I have experienced similar results when training SchNet models for my current paper. Could SchNet benefit from adding dropout to the network? Is this anything that has been tested before?

@jstoppelman yes, the units are not converted in any way. I also checked that. Still I do not really know what is goinig on... I have not trained any MaterialsProject models myself, but the overfitting seems not right. Could you check the size of the dataset for me? Maybe the database is corrupted and some data is missing?
@Dankomaister we are working on the building blocks of SchNetPack at the moment, in order to allow different architectures (e.g. PhysNet). This will probably also include the support of dropout layers, but I have not tested it yet.

@Stefaanhess The training that I made the figure from is using a subset of the first 63000 configurations, with 49600 for training and 12400 for validation and I left 1000 points for testing. I did this so the size of my training + validation set was the same as the SchNetPack paper. The total size of the Materials Project database is 124478 crystals currently, I only created a subset of the structures to see if that created any change in the training. Here is the command I used to initialize the database.
```
sub = [i for i in range(63000)]
mp = MaterialsProject("../../mp.db", load_only=[MaterialsProject.EformationPerAtom], subset=sub, environment_provider=sch.environment.AseEnvironmentProvider(5))
```
 Thanks for the help!
@jstoppelman I will run the MaterialsProject-script myself in order to check the results. Maybe that can help to narrow down the problem...
@Stefaanhess ok, thank you for checking. I haven't found anything wrong with my script yet, although there could be something I'm still missing that I don't see.

issue.title: Fix filter normalization for materials

repository.name: schnetpack
repository.description: SchNetPack - Deep Neural Networks for Atomistic Systems

issue.body:
Fixes #226 

Parsing had a bug where the filter were not normalized for Materials Project and OMDB.

Still needs to be tested.
